sen.j: 長信（ちょうしん、長和3年（1014年） - 延久4年9月30日 (旧暦)（1072年11月12日））は、平安時代中期の真言宗の僧侶。
sen.e: Choshin (1014-November 12, 1072) was a Buddhist monk of Shingon sect, in the mid Heian period.

sen.j: 母は大納言源重光（代明親王の子）の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of a Dainagon (chief councilor of state), MINAMOTO no Shigemitsu who was a child of the Imperial Prince Yoshiakira.

sen.j: 仁和寺観音院の延尋（源扶義の子）の元に入門して出家、永承3年（1047年）に同院で性信入道親王から灌頂を受ける。
sen.e: He became a disciple of Enjin who was a child of MINAMOTO no Sukenori in Kannon-in of Ninna-ji Temple, and became a priest there, then received kanjo (a ceremony to be the successor) by priest-Imperial Prince Shoshin.

sen.j: 永承5年（1049年）に東寺に移って権少僧都・一身阿闍梨となる。
sen.e: In 1049, he moved to To-ji Temple and became gon shosozu (Junior lesser prelate), isshin-ajari (a special class of the teaching priests, who are noble and permitted to play role of ajari).

sen.j: 天喜2年（1054年）には東寺と真言宗全体の長である第29代東寺長者に任じられて法印に昇進する。
sen.e: In 1054, He was appointed as the 29th choja of the To-ji Temple who was the chief abbot of the To-ji temple and the entire Shingon sect, and promoted to hoin (the highest rank among Buddhist priests).

sen.j: 治暦2年（1066年）権僧正となり、この年の旱魃に際して僧侶20人を率いて雨乞いの修法を行った。
sen.e: In 1066, he became gon no sojo (a highest ranking priest, next to a sojo) and made a ritual for rain along with 20 priests on the drought that year.

sen.j: 延久2年（1070年）には僧正に任じられて、翌年には東寺内に「池坊」を建立してそこに居住する。
sen.e: In 1070, he was appointed as Sojo, and in the following year he erected "Ikenobo" in the territory of To-ji Temple and lived there.

sen.j: 後三条天皇の信任が厚く、この年には百官を連れて長信の元を訪れ、封戸25戸を下賜された。
sen.e: He had been in great confidence of the Emperor Gosanjo, who visited Chosin with his all the officials that year and granted fuko (a vassal household allotted to courtier, shrines and temples) 25-households.
